title: Trade: Orgalim Position Paper on the carbon border adjustment mechanism (CBAM)
author: Toma Mikalauskaitė Silvia Selandar
text:
Toma Mikalauskaitė 
						
                        
						                             Adviser – Energy and Environment 
						
                        
                         
                     Orgalim calls for an impact assessment of the carbon border adjustment mechanism (CBAM) for downstream industries. Orgalim also calls for WTO-compatibility of CBAM and a clarification of its anti-circumvention provisions. Finally, Orgalim cautions against the excessive use of delegated or implementing acts in CBAM and calls for CBAM to be designed in a non-protectionist way. To read our recommendations in full, please download the document above.
